member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Properties.Resources.ConnectionHasNotBeenInitialized
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Connection property has not been initialized..

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Properties.Resources.StringCannotBeEmpty
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The specified string argument {0} must not be empty..

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection
member.summary: Provides a reliable way of opening connections to, and executing commands against, the SQL Database databases taking potential network unreliability and connection retry requirements into account.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified connection string. Uses the default retry policy for connections and commands unless retry settings are provided in the connection string.
member.param: The connection string used to open the SQL Database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified connection string and a policy that defines whether to retry a request if a connection or command fails.
member.param: The connection string used to open the SQL Database.
The retry policy that defines whether to retry a request if a connection or command fails.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified connection string and a policy that defines whether to retry a request if a connection or command fails.
member.param: The connection string used to open the SQL Database.
The retry policy that defines whether to retry a request if a connection fails to be established.
The retry policy that defines whether to retry a request if a command fails to be executed.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.Open
member.summary: Opens a database connection with the settings specified by the ConnectionString and ConnectionRetryPolicy properties.
member.returns: An object that represents the open connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.Open(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Opens a database connection with the settings specified by the connection string and the specified retry policy.
member.param: The retry policy that defines whether to retry a request if the connection fails to open.
member.returns: An object that represents the open connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ExecuteCommand``1(System.Data.IDbCommand)
member.summary: Executes a SQL command and returns a result that is defined by the specified type . This method uses the retry policy specified when instantiating the SqlAzureConnection class (or the default retry policy if no policy was set at construction time).
member.typeparam: IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Framework type that defines the type of result to be returned.
member.param: The SQL command to be executed.
member.returns: An instance of an IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Framework object that contains the result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ExecuteCommand``1(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.CommandBehavior)
member.summary: Executes a SQL command and returns a result that is defined by the specified type . This method uses the retry policy specified when instantiating the SqlAzureConnection class (or the default retry policy if no policy was set at construction time).
member.typeparam: IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Framework type that defines the type of result to be returned.
member.param: The SQL command to be executed.
A description of the results of the query and its effect on the database.
member.returns: An instance of an IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Frameork object that contains the result.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ExecuteCommand``1(System.Data.IDbCommand,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Executes a SQL command by using the specified retry policy, and returns a result that is defined by the specified type
member.typeparam: IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Framework type that defines the type of result to be returned.
member.param: The SQL command to be executed.
The retry policy that defines whether to retry a command if a connection fails while executing the command.
member.returns: An instance of an IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Frameork object that contains the result.

member.summary: Executes a SQL command by using the specified retry policy, and returns a result that is defined by the specified type
member.typeparam: IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Framework type that defines the type of result to be returned.
member.param: The SQL command to be executed.
The retry policy that defines whether to retry a command if a connection fails while executing the command.
A description of the results of the query and its effect on the database.
member.returns: An instance of an IDataReader, XmlReader, or any other .NET Frameork object that contains the result.

member.summary: Executes a SQL command and returns the number of rows affected.

member.returns: The number of rows affected.

member.summary: Changes the current database for an open Connection object.

member.summary: Opens a database connection with the settings specified by the ConnectionString property of the provider-specific Connection object.

member.summary: Closes the connection to the database.

member.summary: Creates a new connection that is a copy of the current instance, including the connection string, connection retry policy, and command retry policy.
member.returns: A new object that is a copy of this instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.Dispose

member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting managed and unmanaged resources.
member.param: A flag indicating that managed resources must be released.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ConnectionString
member.summary: Gets or sets the connection string for opening a connection to the SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ConnectionRetryPolicy
member.summary: Gets the policy that determines whether to retry a connection request, based on how many times the request has been made and the reason for the last failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.CommandRetryPolicy
member.summary: Gets the policy that determines whether to retry a command, based on how many times the request has been made and the reason for the last failure.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.Current
member.summary: Gets an instance of the SqlConnection object that represents the connection to a SQL Database instance.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.SessionTracingId
member.summary: Gets the CONTEXT_INFO value that was set for the current session. This value can be used to trace query execution problems.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies the time to wait while trying to establish a connection before terminating the attempt and generating an error.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.Database
member.summary: Gets the name of the current database or the database to be used after a connection is opened.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.State
member.summary: Gets the current state of the connection.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.NonQueryResult
member.summary: This helpers class is intended to be used exclusively for fetching the number of affected records when executing a command by using ExecuteNonQuery.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.ReliableSqlConnection.NetworkConnectivityErrorDetectionStrategy
member.summary: Implements a strategy that detects network connectivity errors such as "host not found".

member.summary: The technology name that can be used to get the default SQL command retry strategy.

member.summary: The technology name that can be used to get the default SQL connection retry strategy.

member.summary: Returns the default retry policy dedicated to handling transient conditions with SQL commands.

member.summary: Returns the default retry policy dedicated to handling transient conditions with SQL connections.
member.returns: The retry policy for SQL connections with the corresponding default strategy (or the default strategy, if no retry strategy for SQL connections was found).

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlDatabaseTransientErrorDetectionStrategy
member.summary: Provides the transient error detection logic for transient faults that are specific to SQL Database.

member.summary: Determines whether the specified exception represents a transient failure that can be compensated by a retry.
member.param: The exception object to be verified.
member.returns: true if the specified exception is considered as transient; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlDatabaseTransientErrorDetectionStrategy.ProcessNetLibErrorCode
member.summary: Error codes reported by the DBNETLIB module.

member.summary: This class is obsolete. The non-obsolete alternative is . Provides the transient error detection logic for transient faults that are specific to SQL Database.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.WindowsAzure.TransientFaultHandling.SqlAzure.SqlAzureTransientErrorDetectionStrategy.IsTransient(System.Exception)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified exception represents a transient failure that can be compensated by a retry.
member.param: The exception object to be verified.
member.returns: true if the specified exception is considered transient; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlCommandExtensions
member.summary: Provides a set of extension methods that add retry capabilities to the standard System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand implementation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlCommandExtensions.ExecuteNonQueryWithRetry(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns the number of rows affected. Uses the default retry policy when executing the command.
member.param: The command object that is required for the extension method declaration.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlCommandExtensions.ExecuteNonQueryWithRetry(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns the number of rows affected. Uses the specified retry policy when executing the command.
member.param: The command object that is required for the extension method declaration.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry a command if a connection fails while executing the command.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlCommandExtensions.ExecuteNonQueryWithRetry(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy)
member.summary: Executes a Transact-SQL statement against the connection and returns the number of rows affected. Uses the specified retry policies when executing the command and establishing a connection.
member.param: The command object that is required for the extension method declaration.
The command retry policy that determines whether to retry a command if it fails while executing.
The connection retry policy that determines whether to re-establish a connection if it drops while executing the command.
member.returns: The number of rows affected.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader
member.summary: Provides a disposable wrapper for SQL XML data reader, which synchronizes the SQL connection disposal with its own life cycle.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Xml.XmlReader)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is associated with the specified SQL connection and the original XML reader.
member.param: The SQL connection that provides access to the XML data for this reader.
The original XML reader that is to be wrapped by this instance.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.GetAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute that has the specified name.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute, or null if the attribute isn't found or its value is .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.GetAttribute(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute that has the specified index.
member.param: The index of the attribute. The index is zero-based. (The first attribute has an index of 0.)
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute. This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.GetAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the value of the attribute that has the specified name and namespace URI.
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: The value of the specified attribute, or null if the attribute isn't found or its value is . This method does not move the reader.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.Close
member.summary: Closes both the original and the associated SQL connection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.LookupNamespace(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves a namespace prefix in the current element's scope.
member.param: The prefix whose namespace URI you want to resolve. To match the default namespace, pass an empty string.
member.returns: The namespace URI to which the prefix maps, or null if no matching prefix is found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute that has the specified name and namespace URI.
member.param: The local name of the attribute.
The namespace URI of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.MoveToAttribute(System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the attribute that has the specified name.
member.param: The qualified name of the attribute.
member.returns: true if the attribute is found; otherwise, false. If false, the reader's position does not change.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.MoveToElement
member.summary: Moves to the element that contains the current attribute node.
member.returns: true if the reader is positioned on an attribute (in which case, the reader moves to the element that owns the attribute); false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute (in which case, the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the first attribute.
member.returns: true if an attribute exists (in which case, the reader moves to the first attribute); otherwise, false (in which case, the position of the reader does not change).

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves to the next attribute.
member.returns: true if there is a next attribute; false if there are no more attributes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.Read
member.summary: Reads the next node from the stream.
member.returns: true if the next node was read successfully; false if there are no more nodes to read.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.ReadAttributeValue
member.summary: Parses the attribute value into one or more Text, EntityReference, or EndEntity nodes.
member.returns: true if there are nodes to return, false if the reader is not positioned on an attribute node when the initial call is made or if all the attribute values have been read. An empty attribute such as misc="" returns true with a single node that has a value of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.ResolveEntity
member.summary: Resolves the entity reference for EntityReference nodes.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.AttributeCount
member.summary: Returns the number of attributes on the current node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.BaseURI
member.summary: Returns the base Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the current node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.Depth
member.summary: Returns the depth of the current node in the XML document.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.EOF
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the reader is positioned at the end of the stream.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.HasValue
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current node can have a .

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current node is an empty element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.LocalName
member.summary: Returns the local name of the current node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.NameTable
member.summary: Returns the that is associated with this implementation.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.NamespaceURI
member.summary: Returns the namespace URI (as defined in the W3C Namespace specification) of the node on which the reader is positioned.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.NodeType
member.summary: Returns the type of the current node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.Prefix
member.summary: Returns the namespace prefix that is associated with the current node.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.ReadState
member.summary: Returns the state of the reader.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.SqlXmlReader.Value
member.summary: Returns the text value of the current node.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling modes in SQL Database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode.NoThrottling
member.summary: Corresponds to the "No Throttling" throttling mode, in which all SQL statements can be processed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectUpdateInsert
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject Update / Insert" throttling mode, in which SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, CREATE TABLE, and CREATE INDEX are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectAllWrites
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject All Writes" throttling mode, in which SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, and DROP are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectAll
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Reject All" throttling mode, in which all SQL statements are rejected.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingMode.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling mode whereby throttling mode cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingType
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling types in SQL Database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingType.None
member.summary: Indicates that no throttling was applied to a given resource.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingType.Soft
member.summary: Corresponds to a soft throttling type. Soft throttling is applied when machine resources such as, CPU, I/O, storage, and worker threads exceed predefined safety thresholds despite the load balancers best efforts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingType.Hard
member.summary: Corresponds to a hard throttling type. Hard throttling is applied when the machine is out of resources, for example storage space. With hard throttling, no new connections are allowed to the databases hosted on the machine until resources are freed up.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling type in the event that the throttling type cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType
member.summary: Defines the types of resources in SQL Database that may be subject to throttling conditions.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalDatabaseSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Physical Database Space" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.PhysicalLogSpace
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Physical Log File Space" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.LogWriteIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Transaction Log Write IO Delay" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.DataReadIoDelay
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Database Read IO Delay" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.Cpu
member.summary: Corresponds to the "CPU" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.DatabaseSize
member.summary: Corresponds to the "Database Size" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.WorkerThreads
member.summary: Corresponds to the "SQL Worker Thread Pool" resource, which may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.Internal
member.summary: Corresponds to an internal resource that may be subject to throttling.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottledResourceType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown resource type in the event that the actual resource cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition
member.summary: Implements an object that holds the decoded reason code returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions are encountered.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottlingErrorNumber
member.summary: Gets the error number that corresponds to the throttling conditions reported by SQL Database.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.throttledResources
member.summary: Maintains a collection of key/value pairs where a key is the resource type and a value is the type of throttling applied to the given resource type.

member.name: F:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.sqlErrorCodeRegEx
member.summary: Provides a compiled regular expression used to extract the reason code from the error message.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.FromException(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlException)
member.summary: Determines throttling conditions from the specified SQL exception.
member.param: The object that contains information relevant to an error returned by SQL Server when throttling conditions were encountered.
member.returns: An instance of the object that holds the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions were encountered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.FromError(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlError)
member.summary: Determines the throttling conditions from the specified SQL error.
member.param: The object that contains information relevant to a warning or error returned by SQL Server.
member.returns: An instance of the object that holds the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when throttling conditions were encountered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.FromReasonCode(System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines the throttling conditions from the specified reason code.
member.param: The reason code returned by SQL Database that contains the throttling mode and the exceeded resource types.
member.returns: An instance of the object holding the decoded reason codes returned from SQL Database when encountering throttling conditions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.ToString
member.summary: Returns a textual representation of the current ThrottlingCondition object, including the information held with respect to throttled resources.
member.returns: A string that represents the current ThrottlingCondition object.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.Unknown
member.summary: Gets an unknown throttling condition in the event that the actual throttling condition cannot be determined.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Gets the value that reflects the throttling mode in SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.ThrottledResources
member.summary: Gets a list of the resources in the SQL Database that were subject to throttling conditions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDataSpace
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether physical data file space throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnLogSpace
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether physical log space throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnLogWrite
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether transaction activity throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDataRead
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether data read activity throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnCpu
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether CPU throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnDatabaseSize
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether database size throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsThrottledOnWorkerThreads
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether concurrent requests throttling was reported by SQL Database.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.Data.ThrottlingCondition.IsUnknown
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether throttling conditions were not determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope
member.summary: Provides support for retry policy-aware transactional scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified retry policy.
member.param: The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.TimeSpan,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified time-out value and requirements. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.
The TimeSpan after which the transaction scope times out and aborts the transaction.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified time-out value, transaction scope options, and retry policy. Uses the ReadCommitted isolation level by default.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.
The TimeSpan after which the transaction scope times out and aborts the transaction.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.Transactions.TransactionOptions,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.

A structure that describes the transaction options to use if a new transaction is created. If an existing transaction is used, the time-out value in this parameter applies to the transaction scope. If that time expires before the scope is disposed, the transaction is aborted.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,System.Transactions.TransactionOptions,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements and retry policy.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.

A structure that describes the transaction options to use if a new transaction is created. If an existing transaction is used, the time-out value in this parameter applies to the transaction scope. If that time expires before the scope is disposed, the transaction is aborted.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.TransactionScopeOption,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified requirements and retry policy. Uses the ReadCommitted isolation level by default.
member.param: One of the enumeration values that specifies the transaction requirements associated with this transaction scope.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified retry policy and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.TimeSpan,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified time-out value, and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction. Implements no retry policy, but just invokes the unit of work exactly once.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction.
The TimeSpan after which the transaction scope times out and aborts the transaction.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.#ctor(System.Transactions.Transaction,System.TimeSpan,Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.RetryPolicy,System.Action)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified time-out value, and sets the specified transaction as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction. Uses the specified retry policy.
member.param: The transaction to be set as the ambient transaction, so that transactional work performed inside the scope uses this transaction.
The TimeSpan after which the transaction scope times out and aborts the transaction.
The retry policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
A delegate that represents the executable unit of work that will be retried upon failure.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.InvokeUnitOfWork
member.summary: Executes the underlying unit of work and retries as prescribed by the current retry policy.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.Complete
member.summary: Indicates that all operations within the scope have been completed successfully.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.Dispose
member.summary: Ends the transaction scope.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.InitializeRetryPolicy
member.summary: Configures the specified retry policy to work with a transactional scope.

member.name: P:Microsoft.Practices.EnterpriseLibrary.TransientFaultHandling.TransactionRetryScope.RetryPolicy
member.summary: Gets the policy that determines whether to retry the execution of the entire scope if a transient fault is encountered.
